  • java.lang.Object
    • io.atomix.resource.AbstractResource<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Managed<T>, Resource<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractDistributedValue, DistributedLock, DistributedMap, DistributedMultiMap, DistributedQueue, DistributedSet

    public abstract class AbstractResource<T extends Resource<T>>
extends Object
implements Resource<T>
    Abstract resource.

      • state

        public Resource.State state()
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Returns the current resource state.

        The resource's Resource.State is indicative of the resource's ability to communicate with the cluster at any given time. Users of the resource should use the state to determine when guarantees may be lost. See the Resource.State documentation for information on the specific states, and see resource implementation documentation for the implications of different states on resource consistency.

        Specified by:
        state in interface Resource<T extends Resource<T>>
        Returns:
        The current resource state.

      • open

        public CompletableFuture<T> open()
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Opens the resource.

        Once the resource is opened, the resource will be transitioned to the Resource.State.CONNECTED state and the returned CompletableFuture will be completed.

        Specified by:
        open in interface Managed<T extends Resource<T>>
        Specified by:

      • close

        public CompletableFuture<Void> close()
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Closes the resource.

        Once the resource is closed, the resource will be transitioned to the Resource.State.CLOSED state and the returned CompletableFuture will be completed. Thereafter, attempts to operate on the resource will fail.

        Specified by:
        close in interface Managed<T extends Resource<T>>
        Specified by:
        close in interface Resource<T extends Resource<T>>
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the resource is closed.
